group.name: Plugin Commands: Demand Response and Load Control Server
group.description: The drlc-server plugin contributes CLI commands to the application framework to be used for constructing demand response load control commands on the server side.

command.description: Print the Demand Response Load Control Table.

Schedule a load control event in the load control event table on a load control server. load control event bytes are expected as 23 raw bytes in the form {<eventId:4> <deviceClass:2> >ueg:1> >startTime:4> >duration:2> <criticalityLevel:1> >coolingTempOffset:1> >heatingTempOffset:1> >coolingTempSetPoint:2> >heatingTempSetPoint:2> >afgLoadPercentage:1> <dutyCycle:1> <eventControl:1> } all multibyte values should be little endian as though they were coming over the air. Example: plugin drlc-server slce 0 23 { ab 00 00 00 ff 0f 00 00 00 00 00 01 00 01 00 00 09 1a 09 1a 0a 00 }

arg.name: index
arg.description: Location in the load control event table for the event to be scheduled

arg.name: length
arg.description: The length in the number of bytes

arg.name: event
arg.description: Byte array value for the load control event

command.description: Schedules a load control event on the server.

arg.name: index
arg.description: Index of the load control event table that will be configured.

arg.name: eventId
arg.description: The issuer event ID for this load control event.

arg.name: deviceClass
arg.description: The device class bitfield this event applies to.

arg.name: utilityEnrollmentGroup
arg.description: The UEG of the load control event.

arg.name: startTime
arg.description: Time when the load control event should start.

arg.name: duration
arg.description: Duration, in minutes, of the event.

arg.name: criticalityLevel
arg.description: The level of criticality of the event. Higher values are more critical.

arg.name: eventControl
arg.description: Bitmask that identifies other control options for the event.

command.description: Command used on a DRLC server to send a scheduled load control event out of the load control event table.

arg.name: index
arg.description: index of the load control event in the server's load control event table.
